comment.author: 68512117@N02
comment._content: This is B-24L-5-CO 44-41453 "NIGHT CLUBBER" which flew with the 14AF 308BG 425BS. It crashed 13 June 1945 on a flight from Chengtu, China to Dergaon, India to pick up gasoline to bring back to China. Their fuel gauges were indicating "low," and they lost an engine 45 minutes out, but, according to their A-1, they had enough fuel for the mission. Still, the pilot requested a straight in approach at Dergaon, which was denied. The plane queued up in the landing pattern and lost the remaining three engines. The pilot set it down in a rice paddy, but, with nose high, the belly hit a dike. No one was killed; some were injured. Pilot: Clifford L. Peterson, copilot: Fitzgerald, bombardier: Horace O. Bedsole; radio operator, flight engineer
